member.name: T:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits
member.summary: Structure reporting implementation-dependent physical device limits.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxImageDimension1D
member.summary: The maximum dimension (width) of an image created with an .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxImageDimension2D
member.summary: The maximum dimension (width or height) of an image created with an and without set in flags.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxImageDimension3D
member.summary: The maximum dimension (width, height, or depth) of an image created with an .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxImageDimensionCube
member.summary: The maximum dimension (width or height) of an image created with an and with set in flags.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxImageArrayLayers
member.summary: The maximum number of layers (array layers) for an image.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTexelBufferElements
member.summary: The maximum number of addressable texels for a buffer view created on a buffer which was created with the or set in the member.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxUniformBufferRange
member.summary: The maximum value that can be specified in the range member of any structures passed to a call to for descriptors of type or .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxStorageBufferRange
member.summary: The maximum value that can be specified in the range member of any structures passed to a call to for descriptors of type or .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPushConstantsSize
member.summary: The maximum size, in bytes, of the pool of push constant memory. For each of the push constant ranges indicated by the member, + must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxMemoryAllocationCount
member.summary: The maximum number of device memory allocations, as created by , which can simultaneously exist.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxSamplerAllocationCount
member.summary: The maximum number of sampler objects, as created by , which can simultaneously exist on a device.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.BufferImageGranularity
member.summary: The granularity, in bytes, at which buffer or linear image resources, and optimal image resources can be bound to adjacent offsets in the same object without aliasing.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.SparseAddressSpaceSize
member.summary: The total amount of address space available, in bytes, for sparse memory resources. This is an upper bound on the sum of the size of all sparse resources, regardless of whether any memory is bound to them.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxBoundDescriptorSets
member.summary: The maximum number of descriptor sets that can be simultaneously used by a pipeline. All decorations in shader modules must have a value less than .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPerStageDescriptorSamplers
member.summary: The maximum number of samplers that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout. Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit. A descriptor is accessible to a shader stage when the member has the bit for that shader stage set.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPerStageDescriptorUniformBuffers
member.summary: The maximum number of uniform buffers that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout. Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit. A descriptor is accessible to a shader stage when the member has the bit for that shader stage set.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPerStageDescriptorStorageBuffers
member.summary: The maximum number of storage buffers that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout. Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit. A descriptor is accessible to a pipeline shader stage when the member has the bit for that shader stage set.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPerStageDescriptorSampledImages
member.summary: The maximum number of sampled images that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout. Descriptors with a type of , , or count against this limit. A descriptor is accessible to a pipeline shader stage when the member has the bit for that shader stage set.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPerStageDescriptorStorageImages
member.summary: The maximum number of storage images that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout. Descriptors with a type of , or count against this limit. A descriptor is accessible to a pipeline shader stage when the member has the bit for that shader stage set.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPerStageDescriptorInputAttachments
member.summary: The maximum number of input attachments that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout. Descriptors with a type of count against this limit. A descriptor is accessible to a pipeline shader stage when the member has the bit for that shader stage set. These are only supported for the fragment stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPerStageResources
member.summary: The maximum number of resources that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout. Descriptors with a type of , , , , , , , , , or count against this limit. For the fragment shader stage the framebuffer color attachments also count against this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetSamplers
member.summary: The maximum number of samplers that can be included in descriptor bindings in a pipeline layout across all pipeline shader stages and descriptor set numbers. Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetUniformBuffers
member.summary: The maximum number of uniform buffers that can be included in descriptor bindings in a pipeline layout across all pipeline shader stages and descriptor set numbers. Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetUniformBuffersDynamic
member.summary: The maximum number of dynamic uniform buffers that can be included in descriptor bindings in a pipeline layout across all pipeline shader stages and descriptor set numbers. Descriptors with a type of count against this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetStorageBuffers
member.summary: The maximum number of storage buffers that can be included in descriptor bindings in a pipeline layout across all pipeline shader stages and descriptor set numbers. Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetStorageBuffersDynamic
member.summary: The maximum number of dynamic storage buffers that can be included in descriptor bindings in a pipeline layout across all pipeline shader stages and descriptor set numbers. Descriptors with a type of count against this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetSampledImages
member.summary: The maximum number of sampled images that can be included in descriptor bindings in a pipeline layout across all pipeline shader stages and descriptor set numbers. Descriptors with a type of , , or count against this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetStorageImages
member.summary: The maximum number of storage images that can be included in descriptor bindings in a pipeline layout across all pipeline shader stages and descriptor set numbers. Descriptors with a type of , or count against this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetInputAttachments
member.summary: The maximum number of input attachments that can be included in descriptor bindings in a pipeline layout across all pipeline shader stages and descriptor set numbers. Descriptors with a type of count against this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexInputAttributes
member.summary: The maximum number of vertex input attributes that can be specified for a graphics pipeline. These are described in the array of structures that are provided at graphics pipeline creation time via the member.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexInputBindings
member.summary: The maximum number of vertex buffers that can be specified for providing vertex attributes to a graphics pipeline. These are described in the array of structures that are provided at graphics pipeline creation time via the member. The member must be less than this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexInputAttributeOffset
member.summary: The maximum vertex input attribute offset that can be added to the vertex input binding stride. The member structure must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexInputBindingStride
member.summary: The maximum vertex input binding stride that can be specified in a vertex input binding. The member must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexOutputComponents
member.summary: The maximum number of components of output variables which can be output by a vertex shader.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationGenerationLevel
member.summary: The maximum tessellation generation level supported by the fixed-function tessellation primitive generator.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationPatchSize
member.summary: The maximum patch size, in vertices, of patches that can be processed by the tessellation control shader and tessellation primitive generator. The member specified at pipeline creation time and the value provided in the OutputVertices execution mode of shader modules must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationControlPerVertexInputComponents
member.summary: The maximum number of components of input variables which can be provided as per-vertex inputs to the tessellation control shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationControlPerVertexOutputComponents
member.summary: The maximum number of components of per-vertex output variables which can be output from the tessellation control shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationControlPerPatchOutputComponents
member.summary: The maximum number of components of per-patch output variables which can be output from the tessellation control shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationControlTotalOutputComponents
member.summary: The maximum total number of components of per-vertex and per-patch output variables which can be output from the tessellation control shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationEvaluationInputComponents
member.summary: The maximum number of components of input variables which can be provided as per-vertex inputs to the tessellation evaluation shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationEvaluationOutputComponents
member.summary: The maximum number of components of per-vertex output variables which can be output from the tessellation evaluation shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxGeometryShaderInvocations
member.summary: The maximum invocation count supported for instanced geometry shaders. The value provided in the`Invocations execution mode of shader modules must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxGeometryInputComponents
member.summary: The maximum number of components of input variables which can be provided as inputs to the geometry shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxGeometryOutputComponents
member.summary: The maximum number of components of output variables which can be output from the geometry shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxGeometryOutputVertices
member.summary: The maximum number of vertices which can be emitted by any geometry shader.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxGeometryTotalOutputComponents
member.summary: The maximum total number of components of output, across all emitted vertices, which can be output from the geometry shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFragmentInputComponents
member.summary: The maximum number of components of input variables which can be provided as inputs to the fragment shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFragmentOutputAttachments
member.summary: The maximum number of output attachments which can be written to by the fragment shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFragmentDualSrcAttachments
member.summary: The maximum number of output attachments which can be written to by the fragment shader stage when blending is enabled and one of the dual source blend modes is in use.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFragmentCombinedOutputResources
member.summary: The total number of storage buffers, storage images, and output buffers which can be used in the fragment shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeSharedMemorySize
member.summary: The maximum total storage size, in bytes, of all variables declared with the WorkgroupLocal storage class in shader modules (or with the shared storage qualifier in GLSL) in the compute shader stage.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeXWorkGroupCount
member.summary: The maximum number of local workgroups that can be dispatched by a single dispatch command. This value represents the maximum number of local workgroups for the X dimension. The x parameter to the command must be less than or equal to the limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeYWorkGroupCount
member.summary: The maximum number of local workgroups that can be dispatched by a single dispatch command. This value represents the maximum number of local workgroups for the Y dimension. The y parameter to the command must be less than or equal to the limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeZWorkGroupCount
member.summary: The maximum number of local workgroups that can be dispatched by a single dispatch command. This value represents the maximum number of local workgroups for the Z dimension. The z parameter to the command must be less than or equal to the limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeWorkGroupInvocations
member.summary: The maximum total number of compute shader invocations in a single local workgroup. The product of the X, Y, and Z sizes as specified by the LocalSize execution mode in shader modules and by the object decorated by the WorkgroupSize decoration must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeXWorkGroupSize
member.summary: The maximum size of a local compute workgroup, per dimension. This value represents the maximum local workgroup size in the X dimension. The x size specified by the LocalSize execution mode and by the object decorated by the WorkgroupSize decoration in shader modules must be less than or equal to the limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeYWorkGroupSize
member.summary: The maximum size of a local compute workgroup, per dimension. This value represents the maximum local workgroup size in the Y dimension. The y size specified by the LocalSize execution mode and by the object decorated by the WorkgroupSize decoration in shader modules must be less than or equal to the limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeZWorkGroupSize
member.summary: The maximum size of a local compute workgroup, per dimension. This value represents the maximum local workgroup size in the Z dimension. The z size specified by the LocalSize execution mode and by the object decorated by the WorkgroupSize decoration in shader modules must be less than or equal to the limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.SubPixelPrecisionBits
member.summary: The number of bits of subpixel precision in framebuffer coordinates.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.SubTexelPrecisionBits
member.summary: The number of bits of precision in the division along an axis of an image used for minification and magnification filters. 2** is the actual number of divisions along each axis of the image represented. The filtering hardware will snap to these locations when computing the filtered results.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MipmapPrecisionBits
member.summary:
The number of bits of division that the LOD calculation for mipmap fetching get snapped to when determining the contribution from each mip level to the mip filtered results. 2** is the actual number of divisions.
For example, if this value is 2 bits then when linearly filtering between two levels, each level could contribute: 0%, 33%, 66%, or 100% (this is just an example and the amount of contribution should be covered by different equations in the spec).

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDrawIndexedIndexValue
member.summary: The maximum index value that can be used for indexed draw calls when using 32-bit indices. This excludes the primitive restart index value of 0xFFFFFFFF.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDrawIndirectCount
member.summary: The maximum draw count that is supported for indirect draw calls.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxSamplerLodBias
member.summary: The maximum absolute sampler level of detail bias. The sum of the member and the Bias operand of image sampling operations in shader modules (or 0 if no Bias operand is provided to an image sampling operation) are clamped to the range [-,+].

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxSamplerAnisotropy
member.summary: The maximum degree of sampler anisotropy. The maximum degree of anisotropic filtering used for an image sampling operation is the minimum of the member and this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxViewports
member.summary: The maximum number of active viewports. The member length that is provided at pipeline creation must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxViewportXDimension
member.summary: The maximum viewport width in the X dimension. The maximum viewport dimension must be greater than or equal to the largest image which can be created and used as a framebuffer attachment.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxViewportYDimension
member.summary: The maximum viewport height in Y dimension. The maximum viewport dimension must be greater than or equal to the largest image which can be created and used as a framebuffer attachment.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinViewportBounds
member.summary:
The minimum of the range that the corners of a viewport must be contained in. This range must be at least [-2 size, 2 size - 1], where size = max( , ).
The intent of the limit is to allow a maximum sized viewport to be arbitrarily shifted relative to the output target as long as at least some portion intersects. This would give a bounds limit of [-size + 1, 2 size - 1] which would allow all possible non-empty-set intersections of the output target and the viewport. Since these numbers are typically powers of two, picking the signed number range using the smallest possible number of bits ends up with the specified range.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxViewportBounds
member.summary:
The maximum of the range that the corners of a viewport must be contained in. This range must be at least [-2 size, 2 size - 1], where size = max( , ).
The intent of the limit is to allow a maximum sized viewport to be arbitrarily shifted relative to the output target as long as at least some portion intersects. This would give a bounds limit of [-size + 1, 2 size - 1] which would allow all possible non-empty-set intersections of the output target and the viewport. Since these numbers are typically powers of two, picking the signed number range using the smallest possible number of bits ends up with the specified range.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.ViewportSubPixelBits
member.summary: The number of bits of subpixel precision for viewport bounds. The subpixel precision that floating-point viewport bounds are interpreted at is given by this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinMemoryMapAlignment
member.summary: The minimum required alignment, in bytes, of host visible memory allocations within the host address space. When mapping a memory allocation with , subtracting offset bytes from the returned pointer will always produce an integer multiple of this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinTexelBufferOffsetAlignment
member.summary: The minimum required alignment, in bytes, for the member for texel buffers. When a buffer view is created for a buffer which was created with or set in the member, the offset must be an integer multiple of this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinUniformBufferOffsetAlignment
member.summary: The minimum required alignment, in bytes, for the offset member of the structure for uniform buffers. When a descriptor of type or is updated, the offset must be an integer multiple of this limit. Similarly, dynamic offsets for uniform buffers must be multiples of this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinStorageBufferOffsetAlignment
member.summary: The minimum required alignment, in bytes, for the offset member of the structure for storage buffers. When a descriptor of type or is updated, the offset must be an integer multiple of this limit. Similarly, dynamic offsets for storage buffers must be multiples of this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinTexelOffset
member.summary: The minimum offset value for the ConstOffset image operand of any of the OpImageSample* or OpImageFetch* image instructions.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTexelOffset
member.summary: The maximum offset value for the ConstOffset image operand of any of the OpImageSample* or OpImageFetch* image instructions.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinTexelGatherOffset
member.summary: The minimum offset value for the Offset or ConstOffsets image operands of any of the OpImage*Gather image instructions.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTexelGatherOffset
member.summary: The maximum offset value for the Offset or ConstOffsets image operands of any of the OpImage*Gather image instructions.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinInterpolationOffset
member.summary: The minimum negative offset value for the offset operand of the InterpolateAtOffset extended instruction.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxInterpolationOffset
member.summary: The maximum positive offset value for the offset operand of the InterpolateAtOffset extended instruction.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.SubPixelInterpolationOffsetBits
member.summary: The number of subpixel fractional bits that the x and y offsets to the InterpolateAtOffset extended instruction may be rounded to as fixed-point values.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFramebufferWidth
member.summary: The maximum width for a framebuffer. The member must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFramebufferHeight
member.summary: The maximum height for a framebuffer. The member must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFramebufferLayers
member.summary: The maximum layer count for a layered framebuffer. The member must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.FramebufferColorSampleCounts
member.summary: A bitmask indicating the color sample counts that are supported for all framebuffer color attachments.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.FramebufferDepthSampleCounts
member.summary: A bitmask indicating the supported depth sample counts for all framebuffer depth/stencil attachments, when the format includes a depth component.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.FramebufferStencilSampleCounts
member.summary: A bitmask of bits indicating the supported stencil sample counts for all framebuffer depth/stencil attachments, when the format includes a stencil component.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.FramebufferNoAttachmentsSampleCounts
member.summary: A bitmask of bits indicating the supported sample counts for a framebuffer with no attachments.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxColorAttachments
member.summary: The maximum number of color attachments that can be used by a subpass in a render pass. The length must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.SampledImageColorSampleCounts
member.summary: A bitmask indicating the sample counts supported for all 2D images created with , usage containing , and a non-integer color format.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.SampledImageIntegerSampleCounts
member.summary: A bitmask indicating the sample counts supported for all 2D images created with , usage containing , and an integer color format.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.SampledImageDepthSampleCounts
member.summary: A bitmask indicating the sample counts supported for all 2D images created with , usage containing , and a depth format.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.SampledImageStencilSampleCounts
member.summary: A bitmask indicating the sample supported for all 2D images created with , usage containing , and a stencil format.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.StorageImageSampleCounts
member.summary: A bitmask indicating the sample counts supported for all 2D images created with , and usage containing .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxSampleMaskWords
member.summary: The maximum number of array elements of a variable decorated with the SampleMask built-in decoration.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.TimestampComputeAndGraphics
member.summary: Indicates support for timestamps on all graphics and compute queues. If this limit is set to true, all queues that advertise the or in the support of at least 36.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.TimestampPeriod
member.summary: The number of nanoseconds required for a timestamp query to be incremented by 1.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxClipDistances
member.summary: The maximum number of clip distances that can be used in a single shader stage. The size of any array declared with the ClipDistance built-in decoration in a shader module must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxCullDistances
member.summary: The maximum number of cull distances that can be used in a single shader stage. The size of any array declared with the CullDistance built-in decoration in a shader module must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxCombinedClipAndCullDistances
member.summary: The maximum combined number of clip and cull distances that can be used in a single shader stage. The sum of the sizes of any pair of arrays declared with the ClipDistance and CullDistance built-in decoration used by a single shader stage in a shader module must be less than or equal to this limit.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.DiscreteQueuePriorities
member.summary: The number of discrete priorities that can be assigned to a queue based on the value of each member of VkDeviceQueueCreateInfo::pQueuePriorities. This must be at least 2, and levels must be spread evenly over the range, with at least one level at 1.0, and another at 0.0.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinPointSize
member.summary: The minimum of the range of supported sizes for points. Values written to variables decorated with the PointSize built-in decoration are clamped to this range.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPointSize
member.summary: The maximum of the range of supported sizes for points. Values written to variables decorated with the PointSize built-in decoration are clamped to this range.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MinLineWidth
member.summary: The minimum of the range of supported widths for lines. Values specified by the member or the line width parameter to are clamped to this range.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxLineWidth
member.summary: The maximum of the range of supported widths for lines. Values specified by the member or the line width parameter to are clamped to this range.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.PointSizeGranularity
member.summary: The granularity of supported point sizes. Not all point sizes in the range defined by and are supported. This limit specifies the granularity (or increment) between successive supported point sizes.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.LineWidthGranularity
member.summary: The granularity of supported line widths. Not all line widths in the range defined by and are supported. This limit specifies the granularity (or increment) between successive supported line widths.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.StrictLines
member.summary: Indicates whether lines are rasterized according to the preferred method of rasterization. If set to false, lines may be rasterized under a relaxed set of rules. If set to true, lines are rasterized as per the strict definition.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.StandardSampleLocations
member.summary: Indicates whether rasterization uses the standard sample locations. If set to true, the implementation uses the documented sample locations. If set to false, the implementation may use different sample locations.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.OptimalBufferCopyOffsetAlignment
member.summary: The optimal buffer offset alignment in bytes for and . The per texel alignment requirements are still enforced, this is just an additional alignment recommendation for optimal performance and power.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.OptimalBufferCopyRowPitchAlignment
member.summary: The optimal buffer row pitch alignment in bytes for and . Row pitch is the number of bytes between texels with the same X coordinate in adjacent rows (Y coordinates differ by one). The per texel alignment requirements are still enforced, this is just an additional alignment recommendation for optimal performance and power.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceLimits.NonCoherentAtomSize
member.summary: The size and alignment in bytes that bounds concurrent access to host-mapped device memory.

member.summary: A bitmask of properties for this memory type.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryType.HeapIndex
member.summary: Describes which memory heap this memory type corresponds to, and must be less than the length of .

member.name: T:VulkanCore.MemoryHeap
member.summary: Structure specifying a memory heap.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryHeap.Size
member.summary: The total memory size in bytes in the heap.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryHeap.Flags
member.summary: A bitmask of attribute flags for the heap.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.MemoryProperties
member.summary: Bitmask specifying properties for a memory type.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryProperties.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryProperties.DeviceLocal
member.summary: Indicates that memory allocated with this type is the most efficient for device access. This property will be set if and only if the memory type belongs to a heap with the set.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryProperties.HostVisible
member.summary: Indicates that memory allocated with this type can be mapped for host access using .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryProperties.HostCoherent
member.summary: Indicates that the host cache management commands and are not needed to flush host writes to the device or make device writes visible to the host, respectively.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryProperties.HostCached
member.summary: Indicates that memory allocated with this type is cached on the host. Host memory accesses to uncached memory are slower than to cached memory, however uncached memory is always host coherent.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryProperties.LazilyAllocated
member.summary:
Indicates that the memory type only allows device access to the memory. Memory types must not have both and set.
Additionally, the object's backing memory may be provided by the implementation lazily.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.MemoryHeaps
member.summary: Bitmask specifying attribute flags for a heap.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryHeaps.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryHeaps.DeviceLocal
member.summary:
Indicates that the heap corresponds to device local memory.
Device local memory may have different performance characteristics than host local memory, and may support different memory property flags.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.MemoryHeaps.MultiInstanceKhx
member.summary:
Indicates that in a logical device representing more than one physical device, there is a per-physical device instance of the heap memory.
By default, an allocation from such a heap will be replicated to each physical device's instance of the heap.

member.summary: Specifies device-specific limits of the physical device.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceProperties.SparseProperties
member.summary: Specifies various sparse related properties of the physical device.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceSparseProperties
member.summary: Structure specifying physical device sparse memory properties.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceSparseProperties.ResidencyStandard2DBlockShape
member.summary: Is true if the physical device will access all single-sample 2D sparse resources using the standard sparse image block shapes (based on image format). If this property is not supported the value returned in the member for single-sample 2D images is not required to match the standard sparse image block dimensions listed in the table.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceSparseProperties.ResidencyStandard2DMultisampleBlockShape
member.summary: Is true if the physical device will access all multisample 2D sparse resources using the standard sparse image block shapes (based on image format). If this property is not supported, the value returned in the member for multisample 2D images is not required to match the standard sparse image block dimensions listed in the table.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceSparseProperties.ResidencyStandard3DBlockShape
member.summary: Is true if the physical device will access all 3D sparse resources using the standard sparse image block shapes (based on image format). If this property is not supported, the value returned in the member for 3D images is not required to match the standard sparse image block dimensions listed in the table.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceSparseProperties.ResidencyAlignedMipSize
member.summary: Is true if images with mip level dimensions that are not integer multiples of the corresponding dimensions of the sparse image block may: be placed in the mip tail. If this property is not reported, only mip levels with dimensions smaller than the imageGranularity member of the structure will be placed in the mip tail. If this property is reported the implementation is allowed to return in the flags member of , indicating that mip level dimensions that are not integer multiples of the corresponding dimensions of the sparse image block will be placed in the mip tail.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PhysicalDeviceSparseProperties.ResidencyNonResidentStrict
member.summary: Specifies whether the physical device can consistently access non-resident regions of a resource. If this property is true, access to non-resident regions of resources will be guaranteed to return values as if the resource were populated with 0; writes to non-resident regions will be discarded.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.QueueFamilyProperties
member.summary: Structure providing information about a queue family.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.QueueFamilyProperties.QueueFlags
member.summary: A bitmask indicating capabilities of the queues in this queue family.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.QueueFamilyProperties.QueueCount
member.summary: The unsigned integer count of queues in this queue family.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.QueueFamilyProperties.TimestampValidBits
member.summary: The unsigned integer count of meaningful bits in the timestamps written via . The valid range for the count is 36..64 bits, or a value of 0, indicating no support for timestamps. Bits outside the valid range are guaranteed to be zeros.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.QueueFamilyProperties.MinImageTransferGranularity
member.summary: The minimum granularity supported for image transfer operations on the queues in this queue family.

member.summary: Indicates that queues in this queue family support graphics operations.

member.summary: Indicates that queues in this queue family support compute operations.

member.summary: Indicates that queues in this queue family support transfer operations.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.Queues.SparseBinding
member.summary: Indicates that queues in this queue family support sparse resource memory management operations.

member.summary: Specifies that the format can be used to create a buffer view that can be bound to a descriptor.

member.summary: Specifies that atomic operations are supported on with this format.

member.summary: Specifies that an image view can be used as a framebuffer color attachment and as an input attachment.

member.summary: Specifies that an image view can be used as a framebuffer color attachment that supports blending and as an input attachment.

member.summary: Specifies that an image view can be used as a framebuffer depth/stencil attachment and as an input attachment.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.BlitSrc
member.summary: Specifies that an image can be used as source image for the command.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.BlitDst
member.summary: Specifies that an image can be used as destination image for the command.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.SampledImageFilterLinear
member.summary:
Specifies that if is also set, an image view can be used with a sampler that has either of magnification or minification filter set to , or mipmap mode set to .
If is also set, an image can be used as the source image to with a .
This bit must only be exposed for formats that also support the or .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.SampledImageFilterCubicImg
member.summary:
Specifies that can be used with a sampler that has either of MagFilter or MinFilter set to , or be the source image for a blit with Filter set to .
This bit must only be exposed for formats that also support the .
If the format being queried is a depth/stencil format, this only indicates that the depth aspect is cubic filterable.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.TransferSrcKhr
member.summary: Specifies that an image can be used as a source image for copy commands.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.TransferDstKhr
member.summary: Specifies that an image can be used as a destination image for copy commands and clear commands.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.SampledImageFilterMinmaxExt
member.summary:
Specifies can be used as a sampled image with a min or max .
This bit must only be exposed for formats that also support the .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.MidpointChromaSamplesKhr
member.summary: Specifies that an application can define a sampler Y'C~B~C~R~ conversion using this format as a source, and that an image of this format can be used with a XChromaOffset and/or YChromaOffset of . Otherwise both XChromaOffset and YChromaOffset must be . If a format does not incorporate chroma downsampling (it is not a "`422`" or "`420`" format) but the implementation supports sampler Y'C~B~C~R~ conversion for this format, the implementation must set .

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.SampledImageYcbcrConversionLinearFilterKhr
member.summary: Specifies that the format can do linear sampler filtering (min/magFilter) whilst sampler Y'C~B~C~R~ conversion is enabled.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.SampledImageYcbcrConversionSeparateReconstructionFilterKhr
member.summary: Specifies that the format can have different chroma, min, and mag filters.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.SampledImageYcbcrConversionChromaReconstructionExplicitKhr
member.summary: Specifies that reconstruction is explicit, as described in textures-chroma-reconstruction. If this bit is not present, reconstruction is implicit by default.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.SampledImageYcbcrConversionChromaReconstructionExplicitForceableKhr
member.summary: Specifies that reconstruction can be forcibly made explicit by setting to true.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.DisjointKhr
member.summary: Specifies that a multi-planar image can have the set during image creation. An implementation must not set for single-plane Formats.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FormatFeatures.CositedChromaSamplesKhr
member.summary: Specifies that an application can define a sampler Y'C~B~C~R~ conversion using this format as a source, and that an image of this format can be used with a XChromaOffset and/or YChromaOffset of . Otherwise both XChromaOffset and YChromaOffset must be . If neither nor is set, the application must not define a sampler Y'C~B~C~R~ conversion using this format as a source.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.ImageTiling
member.summary: Specifies the tiling arrangement of data in an image.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.ImageTiling.Optimal
member.summary: Specifies optimal tiling (texels are laid out in an implementation-dependent arrangement, for more optimal memory access).

member.name: F:VulkanCore.ImageTiling.Linear
member.summary: Specifies linear tiling (texels are laid out in memory in row-major order, possibly with some padding on each row).

member.name: T:VulkanCore.PolygonMode
member.summary: Control polygon rasterization mode.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PolygonMode.Fill
member.summary: Specifies that polygons are rendered using the polygon rasterization rules in this section.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PolygonMode.Line
member.summary: Specifies that polygon edges are drawn as line segments.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PolygonMode.Point
member.summary: Specifies that polygon vertices are drawn as points.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PolygonMode.FillRectangleNV
member.summary:
Specifies that polygons are rendered using polygon rasterization rules, modified to consider a sample within the primitive if the sample location is inside the axis-aligned bounding box of the triangle after projection. Note that the barycentric weights used in attribute interpolation can extend outside the range [0,1] when these primitives are shaded. Special treatment is given to a sample position on the boundary edge of the bounding box.
In such a case, if two rectangles lie on either side of a common edge (with identical endpoints) on which a sample position lies, then exactly one of the triangles must produce a fragment that covers that sample during rasterization.
Polygons rendered in mode may be clipped by the frustum or by user clip planes.
If clipping is applied, the triangle is culled rather than clipped.
Area calculation and facingness are determined for mode using the triangle's vertices.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.FrontFace
member.summary: Interpret polygon front-facing orientation.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FrontFace.CounterClockwise
member.summary: Specifies that a triangle with positive area is considered front-facing.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.FrontFace.Clockwise
member.summary: Specifies that a triangle with negative area is considered front-facing.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.PipelineCache
member.summary:
Opaque handle to a pipeline cache object.
Pipeline cache objects allow the result of pipeline construction to be reused between pipelines and between runs of an application. Reuse between pipelines is achieved by passing the same pipeline cache object when creating multiple related pipelines. Reuse across runs of an application is achieved by retrieving pipeline cache contents in one run of an application, saving the contents, and using them to preinitialize a pipeline cache on a subsequent run. The contents of the pipeline cache objects are managed by the implementation. Applications can manage the host memory consumed by a pipeline cache object and control the amount of data retrieved from a pipeline cache object.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.PipelineLayout
member.summary:
Opaque handle to a pipeline layout object.
Access to descriptor sets from a pipeline is accomplished through a pipeline layout. Zero or more descriptor set layouts and zero or more push constant ranges are combined to form a pipeline layout object which describes the complete set of resources that can be accessed by a pipeline. The pipeline layout represents a sequence of descriptor sets with each having a specific layout. This sequence of layouts is used to determine the interface between shader stages and shader resources. Each pipeline is created using a pipeline layout.

member.name: P:VulkanCore.PipelineLayout.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent of the resource.

member.summary: Structure specifying the parameters of a newly created pipeline layout object.

member.summary: An array of objects.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.PipelineLayoutCreateInfo.PushConstantRanges
member.summary: Structures defining a set of push constant ranges for use in a single pipeline layout. In addition to descriptor set layouts, a pipeline layout also describes how many push constants can be accessed by each stage of the pipeline. Push constants represent a high speed path to modify constant data in pipelines that is expected to outperform memory-backed resource updates.

A render pass represents a collection of attachments, subpasses, and dependencies between the subpasses, and describes how the attachments are used over the course of the subpasses. The use of a render pass in a command buffer is a render pass instance.

member.summary: A bitmask specifying usage of the subpass.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.SubpassDescription.ColorAttachments
member.summary:
Structures that lists which of the render pass's attachments will be used as color attachments in the subpass, and what layout each attachment will be in during the subpass.
Each element of the array corresponds to a fragment shader output location, i.e. if the shader declared an output variable layout(location=X) then it uses the attachment provided in ColorAttachments[X].

member.name: F:VulkanCore.SubpassDescription.InputAttachments
member.summary: Structures that lists which of the render pass's attachments can be read in the fragment shader stage during the subpass, and what layout each attachment will be in during the subpass. Each element of the array corresponds to an input attachment unit number in the shader, i.e. if the shader declares an input variable layout(inputAttachmentIndex=X, set=Y, binding=Z then it uses the attachment provided in InputAttachments[X]. Input attachments must also be bound to the pipeline with a descriptor set, with the input attachment descriptor written in the location (set=Y, binding=Z). Fragment shaders can use subpass input variables to access the contents of an input attachment at the fragment's (x, y, layer) framebuffer coordinates.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.SubpassDescription.ResolveAttachments
member.summary: Is null or an array of structures that lists which of the render pass's attachments are resolved to at the end of the subpass, and what layout each attachment will be in during the multisample resolve operation. If is not null, each of its elements corresponds to a color attachment (the element in at the same index), and a multisample resolve operation is defined for each attachment. At the end of each subpass, multisample resolve operations read the subpass's color attachments, and resolve the samples for each pixel to the same pixel location in the corresponding resolve attachments, unless the resolve attachment index is . If the first use of an attachment in a render pass is as a resolve attachment, then the is effectively ignored as the resolve is guaranteed to overwrite all pixels in the render area.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.SubpassDescription.DepthStencilAttachment
member.summary: Specifies which attachment will be used for depth/stencil data and the layout it will be in during the subpass. Setting the attachment index to or leaving this as null indicates that no depth/stencil attachment will be used in the subpass.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.SubpassDescription.PreserveAttachments
member.summary: Render pass attachment indices describing the attachments that are not used by a subpass, but whose contents must be preserved throughout the subpass.

member.name: M:VulkanCore.SubpassDescription.#ctor(VulkanCore.SubpassDescriptionFlags,VulkanCore.AttachmentReference[],VulkanCore.AttachmentReference[],VulkanCore.AttachmentReference[],System.Nullable{VulkanCore.AttachmentReference},System.Int32[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure.
member.param: A bitmask indicating usage of the subpass.

Structures that lists which of the render passs attachments will be used as color attachments in the subpass, and what layout each attachment will be in during the subpass. Each element of the array corresponds to a fragment shader output location, i.e. if the shader declared an output variable layout(location=X) then it uses the attachment provided in ColorAttachments[X].

Structures that lists which of the render pass's attachments can be read in the shader during the subpass, and what layout each attachment will be in during the subpass. Each element of the array corresponds to an input attachment unit number in the shader, i.e. if the shader declares an input variable layout(inputAttachmentIndex=X, set=Y, binding=Z) then it uses the attachment provided in InputAttachments[X]. Input attachments must also be bound to the pipeline with a descriptor set, with the input attachment descriptor written in the location (set=Y, binding=Z).

Is null or an array of structures that lists which of the render pass's attachments are resolved to at the end of the subpass, and what layout each attachment will be in during the multisample resolve operation. If is not null, each of its elements corresponds to a color attachment (the element in at the same index), and a multisample resolve operation is defined for each attachment. At the end of each subpass, multisample resolve operations read the subpass's color attachments, and resolve the samples for each pixel to the same pixel location in the corresponding resolve attachments, unless the resolve attachment index is . If the first use of an attachment in a render pass is as a resolve attachment, then the is effectively ignored as the resolve is guaranteed to overwrite all pixels in the render area.

Specifies which attachment will be used for depth/stencil data and the layout it will be in during the subpass. Setting the attachment index to or leaving this as null indicates that no depth/stencil attachment will be used in the subpass.
Render pass attachment indices describing the attachments that are not used by a subpass, but whose contents must be preserved throughout the subpass.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.SubpassDescriptionFlags.PerViewAttributesNvx
member.summary: Specifies that shaders compiled for this subpass write the attributes for all views in a single invocation of each vertex processing stage. All pipelines compiled against a subpass that includes this bit must write per-view attributes to the *PerViewNV[] shader outputs, in addition to the non-per-view (e.g. Position) outputs.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.SubpassDescriptionFlags.PerViewPositionXOnlyNvx
member.summary: Specifies that shaders compiled for this subpass use per-view positions which only differ in value in the x component. Per-view viewport mask can also be used.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.Result.SuboptimalKhr

member.name: F:VulkanCore.Result.ErrorOutOfDateKhr
member.summary: A surface has changed in such a way that it is no longer compatible with the swapchain, and further presentation requests using the swapchain will fail. Applications must query the new surface properties and recreate their swapchain if they wish to continue presenting to the surface.

member.name: F:VulkanCore.Result.ErrorIncompatibleDisplayKhr
member.summary: A surface has changed in such a way that it is no longer compatible with the swapchain, and further presentation requests using the swapchain will fail. Applications must query the new surface properties and recreate their swapchain if they wish to continue presenting to the surface.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.Semaphore
member.summary:
Opaque handle to a semaphore object.
Semaphores are a synchronization primitive that can be used to insert a dependency between batches submitted to queues. Semaphores have two states - signaled and unsignaled. The state of a semaphore can be signaled after execution of a batch of commands is completed. A batch can wait for a semaphore to become signaled before it begins execution, and the semaphore is also unsignaled before the batch begins execution.

member.summary: Gets the parent of this resource.

member.summary: Destroy a semaphore object.

member.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created semaphore.

member.name: T:VulkanCore.ShaderModule
member.summary:
Opaque handle to a shader module object.
Shader modules contain shader code and one or more entry points. Shaders are selected from a shader module by specifying an entry point as part of pipeline creation. The stages of a pipeline can use shaders that come from different modules. The shader code defining a shader module must be in the SPIR-V format.
